H0.text: Friction is what causes the studentâ€™s hands to get warm when he rubs them together to warm them.

H1.text: Gravity causes a student's hands to warm when he rubs them together.

H2.text: Magnetism is the cause of the student's hands becoming warm when he rubs them together.

H3.text: Sound is the cause of the student's hands getting warm when he rubs them together.

A4.text: The lost work is accounted for by heat generated by friction.

A5.text: Thus, a force is required to move the back of the contact, and frictional heat is released at the front.
